mechanics.outcome: Creature and any nonmagical objects it is wearing or carrying transform into a solid inanimate substance (usually stone); its weight increases by a factor of ten; it ceases aging
Creature is Incapacitated; creature cannot move; creature cannot speak; creature is unaware of its surroundings

mechanics.trigger: Attack roll targets a Petrified creature
mechanics.outcome: Attack rolls against the creature have Advantage

mechanics.trigger: Petrified creature attempts a Strength or Dexterity saving throw
mechanics.outcome: Creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws
Creature has Resistance to all damage

mechanics.trigger: Petrified creature is subjected to poison or disease OR has existing poison/disease
mechanics.outcome: Creature is Immune to poison and disease; any existing poison or disease in its system is suspended, not neutralized

description_text: A petrified creature is transformed, along with any nonmagical object it is wearing or carrying, into a solid inanimate substance (usually stone). Its weight increases by a factor of ten, and it ceases aging. The creature is incapacitated (see the condition), can't move or speak, and is unaware of its surroundings. Attack rolls against the creature have advantage. The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saving throws. The creature has resistance to all damage. The creature is immune to poison and disease, although a poison or disease already in its system is suspended, not neutralized.
